title: FAQ
text: Common questions about Leaf documentation framework.

title: FAQ > Frequently Asked Questions
text: Common questions about Leaf documentation framework.

title: FAQ > What is Leaf?
text: Leaf is a modern documentation framework built with SolidJS (SolidJS-based) that provides VitePress-compatible markdown syntax and features. It uses TypeScript for type safety and gives you access to the full SolidJS ecosystem.

title: FAQ > How is Leaf different from VitePress?
text: Leaf uses  SolidJS  (SolidJS-based) instead of Vue,  Sylphx tools  (Zen, Silk) for state and styling, and supports both  Bun and Node.js  runtimes. It maintains VitePress-compatible markdown syntax while giving you access to the SolidJS ecosystem.
section: How is Leaf different from VitePress?

title: FAQ > Is Leaf production-ready?
text: Yes! Leaf has all core features implemented and tested: âœ… SSG (Static Site Generation) âœ… SSG (Static Site Generation) âœ… Search functionality âœ… Search functionality âœ… Dark mode âœ… Dark mode âœ… Math equations âœ… Math equations âœ… Mermaid diagrams âœ… Mermaid diagrams âœ… Code highlighting âœ… Code highlighting âœ… Mobile responsive âœ… Mobile responsive

title: FAQ > Is Leaf free to use?
text: Yes, Leaf is open source and free for both commercial and non-commercial use.

title: FAQ > Do I need Bun?
text:
No , Bun is optional but recommended. Leaf works with both Bun and Node.js 18+: ::: tip Why Bun?
Bun provides faster package installation (~2-3x). Build times are similar between Bun and Node.js for most projects.
:::

title: FAQ > Can I use npm or pnpm for package management?
text: Yes! You can use any package manager: All work correctly. Bun is fastest for installation but any will work for builds.

title: FAQ > How does search work?
text: Leaf uses MiniSearch for local fuzzy search. The search index is generated at build time and included in your static site. No server required! Open search with: Cmd/Ctrl + K Cmd/Ctrl + K Click search button in header Click search button in header

Why Leaf?
text: Leaf brings the power of fine-grained reactivity to documentation sites while maintaining the simplicity and speed of VitePress.

title: Why Leaf? > Why Leaf?
text: Leaf brings the power of fine-grained reactivity to documentation sites while maintaining the simplicity and speed of VitePress.

title: Why Leaf? > 1. Fine-Grained Reactivity
text: SolidJS provides superior reactivity without Virtual DOM overhead: Direct DOM Updates : No diffing, no reconciliation Direct DOM Updates : No diffing, no reconciliation Automatic Dependency Tracking : Signals track dependencies automatically Automatic Dependency Tracking : Signals track dependencies automatically Minimal Re-renders : Only affected DOM nodes update Minimal Re-renders : Only affected DOM nodes update Simple Mental Model : Predictable reactivity with signals and effects Simple Mental Model : Predictable reactivity with signals and effects

title: Why Leaf? > 2. Modern Runtime
text: Bun or Node.js  - Use either runtime: Bun : Faster package installation and built-in TypeScript support Bun : Faster package installation and built-in TypeScript support Node.js 18+ : Stable and widely supported Node.js 18+ : Stable and widely supported Both work equally well for production builds Both work equally well for production builds

title: Why Leaf? > 3. Lightweight Runtime
text: Leaf uses  SolidJS  for minimal framework overhead: No Virtual DOM  means less runtime code and faster updates.

title: Why Leaf? > 4. TypeScript First
text: 100% TypeScript with full type safety:

title: Why Leaf? > 5. Better DX (Developer Experience)
text:
::: tip Hot Module Replacement
Fast HMR powered by Vite. Changes reflect in <100ms.
::: ::: tip Zero Configuration
Works out of the box with sensible defaults. Configure only what you need.
::: ::: tip Auto-Generated
Sidebar and TOC are automatically generated from your file structure and headings.
:::

title: Why Leaf? > When to Use Leaf
text: âœ…  Use Leaf if you: Want fine-grained reactivity without Virtual DOM Want fine-grained reactivity without Virtual DOM Prefer SolidJS's simple mental model Prefer SolidJS's simple mental model Need minimal runtime overhead Need minimal runtime overhead Want maximum performance Want maximum performance Use Bun runtime for fast builds Use Bun runtime for fast builds Need TypeScript-first tooling Need TypeScript-first tooling âŒ  Use VitePress if you: Prefer Vue ecosystem Prefer Vue ecosystem Have existing VitePress site Have existing VitePress site Need Vue-specific features Need Vue-specific features Team is Vue-focused Team is Vue-focused

title: Why Leaf? > Build Time
text: Fast builds with Vite and Bun: ~2s for 22 pages including search index generation ~2s for 22 pages including search index generation Hot Module Replacement in <100ms Hot Module Replacement in <100ms Optimized with SolidJS compiler Optimized with SolidJS compiler

title: Why Leaf? > Bundle Size
text: Lightweight runtime with SolidJS: Leaf: Minimal overhead (~12KB framework) Leaf: Minimal overhead (~12KB framework) VitePress: ~75KB gzipped VitePress: ~75KB gzipped No Virtual DOM = Less runtime code No Virtual DOM = Less runtime code

title: Why Leaf? > First Load
text: Both achieve fast first load through SSG: HTML pre-rendered at build time HTML pre-rendered at build time No JavaScript needed for initial view No JavaScript needed for initial view Progressive hydration Progressive hydration

title: Search > Features
text: âš¡ Fast Response  - <50ms search response (tested on M1 MacBook Pro, 16GB RAM) âš¡ Fast Response  - <50ms search response (tested on M1 MacBook Pro, 16GB RAM) ğŸ” Full-Text  - Searches through all content, not just titles ğŸ” Full-Text  - Searches through all content, not just titles ğŸ¯ Relevance Ranking  - Most relevant results appear first ğŸ¯ Relevance Ranking  - Most relevant results appear first âŒ¨ï¸ Keyboard Navigation  - Navigate results with arrow keys âŒ¨ï¸ Keyboard Navigation  - Navigate results with arrow keys ğŸ“± Mobile Friendly  - Works on all devices ğŸ“± Mobile Friendly  - Works on all devices ğŸŒ™ Theme Aware  - Matches your site theme ğŸŒ™ Theme Aware  - Matches your site theme ğŸ’¾ Offline Support  - Search works offline after initial page load ğŸ’¾ Offline Support  - Search works offline after initial page load

title: Search > Opening Search
text: Press    (Mac) or    (Windows/Linux) to open the search dialog from anywhere on your site. Alternatively, click the search icon in the navigation bar.

title: Search > Searching
text: Start typing your query. Results appear as you type: Title matches  - Pages with matching titles appear first Title matches  - Pages with matching titles appear first Content matches  - Pages with matching content follow Content matches  - Pages with matching content follow Excerpt preview  - See context around your search term Excerpt preview  - See context around your search term

title: Search > Navigation
text: â†‘/â†“ Arrow keys  - Move between results â†‘/â†“ Arrow keys  - Move between results Enter  - Navigate to selected result Enter  - Navigate to selected result Esc  - Close search dialog Esc  - Close search dialog

title: Search > How It Works
text: Leaf generates a search index during the build process: Indexing  - All markdown content is processed Indexing  - All markdown content is processed Tokenization  - Content is split into searchable terms Tokenization  - Content is split into searchable terms Weighting  - Titles and headings get higher relevance Weighting  - Titles and headings get higher relevance Compression  - Index is optimized for size Compression  - Index is optimized for size Distribution  - Index is bundled with your site Distribution  - Index is bundled with your site The entire process happens at build time, so there's: âœ… No server required âœ… No server required âœ… No external API calls âœ… No external API calls âœ… No tracking or analytics âœ… No tracking or analytics âœ… Privacy-friendly âœ… Privacy-friendly

title: Search > Search Index
text: The search index is automatically generated from your content:

title: Search > What Gets Indexed
text: Titles  - Page titles (highest weight) Titles  - Page titles (highest weight) Headings  - All H1-H6 headings Headings  - All H1-H6 headings Content  - All paragraph text Content  - All paragraph text Descriptions  - Meta descriptions Descriptions  - Meta descriptions Code comments  - Comments in code blocks Code comments  - Comments in code blocks Links  - Link text Links  - Link text

title: Search > What Doesn't Get Indexed
text: Code syntax  - Code blocks (except comments) Code syntax  - Code blocks (except comments) HTML tags  - Raw HTML is stripped HTML tags  - Raw HTML is stripped Special characters  - Only alphanumeric text Special characters  - Only alphanumeric text

title: Search > Performance
text: The search system is designed for performance: For a typical documentation site with 100 pages: Total index size : ~500KB - 1MB (compressed) Total index size : ~500KB - 1MB (compressed) Download time : <1s on 3G Download time : <1s on 3G Parsing time : <100ms Parsing time : <100ms
